content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help


It looks like the emails are deleted or replaced. Be positive and search some places where these emails can be hidden .

Use the device to search the computer and try to find these emails if they are done where in the trash can or in the spam folder.

If you use a certain anti virus to automaticly fix , and it must ask to what to do , turn it off if that is possible.

In other terms try to use it without the antivirus options to scan mail software or inbox s.

Try to search for the map all mail after loggin in and check it if it s in there or are there some parts of the complete inbox mail in there?


Greetings Firefox volunteer

content:
Hello there

Try to send yourself a test email. Does that still work ? Other option s there are to clear the cache and use the repair folder option to create .

Some times by opening the inbox the entire inbox can appear suddenly or the content can be frozen these symptoms are mostly the same issue there .

Repairing option or workaround. Trying to delete the inbox.msf. That create s automaticly the new inbox by deleting it. Create before that a another name for the normal inbox name. Search after deleting and restarting thunderbird again for or go to the new inbox name map try to compact it. If that succeed s try to open that map. If there are no troubles by opening that map it s oké to use that again.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: What did you do to update your Apple password? You have to create an app-specific password at https://account.apple.com/ and use that in Thunderbird instead of your regular Apple password. Have you done that?
creator: mozilla98

content:
Instructions to set up an iCloud Mail account in a non-Apple mail client such as Thunderbird are given in the 'iCloud Mail server settings' section of the following article:

https://support.apple.com/102525

If you pay attention to what the article says you must use for the password, you'll see it refers to another article, where it explains you have to generate an app specific password first, and use that instead of your account password in Thunderbird:

https://support.apple.com/102654

If Automatic Configuration doesn't work after having done that, switch to Manual Configuration and configure the account as described in the article I linked above. If that still doesn't work, post back with screenshots of the error message you get and the account settings you're trying to use (without showing any passwords).
creator: DavidGG

content: It is annoying that many customer support sites blame Thunderbird when they don't know the answer. I don't either, but if you post screenshots of your incoming server settings pane and your SMTP server settings pane, some suggestions will be forthcoming. My initial thought is that you might be running unencrypted on BT and EE probably requires encryption. The screenshots should show that. And that's just my initial guess.  :)
creator: davidsk

content: You were getting broadband service and an e-mail account from BT? And you are now getting broadband service from EE but want to continue to use BT for the e-mail account? Whether or not the BT e-mail account has been deleted yet, I would expect it to become inaccessible at the end of your last paid period with BT. Has that time passed? Are you still paying for your BT account? Or is there some other reason to expect that you can continue to use BT e-mail?
creator: mozilla98

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
according to this page https://sendgrid.com/en-us/blog/what-is-an-smtp-server

The server is smtp.sendgrid.net on port 587 using TLS encryption on the connection.

Your user name is not clearly set. it is either YXBpa2V5 or apikey . I would try the letter first and the prior value is base64 encoded.

You password will be the API key sendgrid provided you with. Per https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/for-developers/sending-email/getting-started-smtp#before-you-begin

In Thunderbird just add another outgoing server (SMTP) entry in account settings using the sendgrid details and then add an identity in your incoming account to use that SMTP rather than the default attached to your . hostinger.com SMTP

Identities documented here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-identities
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I do not see those folders as being related to the windows file explorer.

I can not replicate that in the new outlook, this is about as close as I can get

So I fired up my outlook365, and waited about 10 minutes for it to retrieve or load of whatever it does with my mailbox settings.

I can replicate it in the classic outlook, but it is folders hanging under the only account I have configured, not any local f0olders on the hard drive of my computer that would show up in the windows file explorer.

SO have got that far, Thunderbird does have a special account called local folders to which you can move emails to be stored on the local machine, independent of the account the mail was received on. Those will appear in Thunderbird as folders, but you will not see them as such in the windows file explorer, just as you did not see the outlook folders there.
creator: MattAuSupport

So much confusion here. Let's see if I may clarify things a bit…

  1. I'm not a moderator, just a contributor.
  2. You're probably referring to this other thread: https://support.mozilla.org/questions/1490349
  3. If this is still the same issue, not a different one, you should continue the conversation there, not start a new thread to continue discussing the same topic.
  4. I didn't tell you send me anything. I told you to post screenshots of your account configuration settings, i.e. to include them in a reply there, which you can do using the Browse button below the 'Post a Reply' box where you type your post.

content:
Hello Gidi,

I had the exact same problem (for Hebrew) and someone pointed to this extension: BiDi Mail UI ("BiDi" for bidirectional). I installed it, and it works perfectly for me.

See the screen shot: the extension adds two buttons - a paragraph sign with an arrow pointing to either direction. I selected the right-to-left one (it's highlighted in blue) and it worked.

Best, Michael
creator: michaelinparis03
